Q: How do I clean fruits and vegetables during #COVID19?

A:

• Rinse fruits and vegetables under cold, running tap water.
• Scrub uncut firm produce with a clean brush.

Text:
Strokes still happen during a pandemic. Remember F.A.S.T.: Face. Arms. Speech. Time to call 9-1-1. 
This simple reminder can help you recognize the signs and symptoms of a stroke and possibly save a life. Learn more: https://t.co/qB0CPSvZaj. #COVID19 https://t.co/lj7E2dgZBt
Name: CDC

Text: The latest CDC #COVIDView report shows the percentage of visits to doctor’s offices and ERs for illnesses likely related to #COVID19 are declining nationally, likely in part a result of widespread efforts to slow the spread of #COVID19: https://t.co/zP4VYlo0Pb https://t.co/mNxn6u7Fsz
Name: CDC

Text: Criminals often take advantage of world events such as #COVID19. If you think you’re a victim of a scam or attempted fraud involving COVID-19, contact the National Center for Disaster Fraud hotline by phone at 1-866-720-5721 or email at disaster@leo.gov. https://t.co/oJWSeGXMYm
Name: CDC

Text: Most people with #COVID19 can recover at home. Take special steps to care for someone who is sick at home and help keep the rest of your household healthy, too. For additional advice, visit https://t.co/q1dtcXUKin. https://t.co/Q5lf1RihIB

Text: Youth/young adults and women who are pregnant should not use e-cigarette products. Adults who do not currently use tobacco products should not start using e-cigarette products.
Name: CDC

Text: Anyone who uses an e-cigarette/vaping product should not buy these products off the street (such as e-cigarette/vaping products with THC or other cannabinoids), and should not modify/add any substances not intended by the manufacturer.
Name: CDC

Text: Until we know more, if concerned about these health risks, CDC recommends you consider refraining from using e-cigarette/vaping products. If you’ve recently used an e-cigarette/vaping product & have symptoms like those reported in this outbreak, see a healthcare provider.
Name: CDC

Text: CDC has sex & age data on 373 cases of lung injury associated w/ use of e-cigarette/vaping products. 67% of cases are people 18 to 34 years old; 16% are younger than 18 years old. Of these, 72% of cases are male.
Name: CDC

Text: As of 9/17, 530 cases of lung injury associated w/ use of e-cigarette/vaping products have been reported from 38 states & one territory. 7 deaths have been confirmed. Learn the latest findings. https://t.co/kW4IMD8sJP https://t.co/UfWIrUaIAW
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : As of 8/27, 215 possible cases of severe respiratory disease associated w/ use of #ecigarette products have been reported from 25 states. @CDCgov and @US_FDA are working closely with state & local health officials to investigate. https://t.co/GpsNUZTV4D
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : .@CDCgov is helping states investigate whether the respiratory illnesses may be linked to specific devices, ingredients or contaminants in the devices, or substances associated with #ecigarette product use.
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : While some cases are similar and appear to be linked to #ecigarette product use, more information is needed to determine what is causing the respiratory illnesses. In many cases, patients have also acknowledged recent use of THC or CBD-containing e-cigarette products.
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : #Ecigarette users: While this investigation is ongoing, consider refraining from using e-cigarette products including nicotine, THC, and CBD. Monitor for symptoms and promptly seek medical attention if you have concerns about your health.
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : #Ecigarette users: Do not buy e-cigarette products off the street (e.g., e-cigarette products with THC and other cannabinoids.) Do not modify e-cigarette products or add any substances to these products that are not intended by the manufacturer.
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : Regardless of the ongoing investigation, #ecigarette products should not be used by youth, young adults, pregnant women, and adults who do not currently use tobacco products.
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : If you use #eigarette products, monitor yourself for symptoms (e.g., cough, shortness of breaths, chest pain) and promptly seek medical attention if you have concerns about your health.
Name: CDC

Text: RT @CDCDirector : If you suffer from any unexpected tobacco or #ecigarette-related health issues, please submit a detailed report to @US_FDA: https://t.co/bTEBz1rowm
Name: CDC
